7_15ATNsS6aHGvBg5xoMP94sXpNaLX4fSHjN.body: Still pretty new, but I would favor the no blacklist option myself. Offense is subjective and personal so once you start piling up what everyone finds offensive, no matter how you try to water it down, you'll inherently end up with very little but the most bland, milk toast of content cause popularity is always a resource and people game for that. The just delete what you don't like from sharing seems like a fine compromise. And thanks testingzeronet12, hadn't heard that about IPFS, I should look into that later.

1525624122_1AHEQxyRG9s6owyJHShB4U4rg9GL5.body:
Debating if I should work on it myself (I am a *terrible* novice-level programmer), but a fiction hosting site would be nice. Kind of like archiveofourown but maybe not so focused on fanfictions and allows authors to ask for donations or just some other way to profit off all that work.

I'll second a good Google Docs replacement.
